meanings.definition: A mark or series of marks stamped on an article of gold, silver, or platinum by the maker as a guarantee of genuineness and purity.
meanings.sent1: The hallmarked on the ring indicated it was made of real gold.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler carefully examined the hallmarked to verify the authenticity of the necklace.
meanings.sent3: Seeing the hallmarked on the bracelet, she joked that it was her 'official' piece of jewelry.
meanings.sent4: The hallmarked on the watch shone like a beacon of quality in the sea of accessories.
meanings.sent5: The intricate hallmarked on the trophy gleamed under the spotlight, showcasing its true value.

meanings.definition: To mark or stamp with a hallmark as a guarantee of genuineness and purity.
meanings.sent1: The silversmith hallmarked each piece with precision and care.
meanings.sent2: Before selling the jewelry, the artisan would always hallmarked it for authenticity.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully hallmarked his signature dish with a sprinkle of edible glitter.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to excellence hallmarked her work ethic, setting her apart from the rest.
meanings.sent5: The artist hallmarked his masterpiece with a unique brushstroke, sealing its place in history.
